title: Military Appreciation Road March scheduled for Sunday
full text:
The seventh annual Military Appreciation Road March is scheduled for Sunday.
The walk honors and remembers all service members killed in action in the global war on terrorism, as well as all veterans and military members who are serving now.
Parking and registration will be in the Bank of North Dakota's parking lot, and registration begins at 8:30 a.m. Vans will follow the group along the Road March route to pick up participants who do not wish to walk the entire nine miles to the North Dakota Veterans Cemetery.
The Road March will begin with a short ceremony at 9:38 a.m. at the Global War on Terrorism Memorial, located at the front gate of the North DakotaNational Guard headquarters at Fraine Barrcks in Bismarck. The time of the ceremony coincides with the local Afghanistan time when Sgt. Travis A. Van Zoest, 21, and Cpl. Curtis R. Mehrer, 21, were killed in action on June 6, 2006, when their vehicle struck an improvised explosive device while on duty in Afghanistan.
Zoest and Mehrer were were members of the First Battalion, 188th Air Defense Artillery Regiment-Security Forces. Two other soldiers in the unit - Cpl. Nathan J. Goodiron, 25, of Mandaree, and Cpl. Christopher K. Kleinwachter, 29, of Wahpeton - also were killed in action while serving in Afghanistan. The unit served in Afghanistan from December 2005 to April 2007.
Rest breaks are scheduled for the McDonald's in Mandan and The Post south of Mandan.

Load-Date: June 8, 2014
